summary: the Muslims Holy pilgrimage to Makkah and Madinah, Saudi Arabia is an annual event that records about 3 million pilgrims for Hajj. nearly 5 million pilgrims participating for the Minor Hajj known as Umrah conducted through the year (1, 2). hajj pilgrims from more than 180 countries across the globe visit Saudi Arabia for the 2 pilgrimages yearly (3). meningococcal quadrivalent (ACYW-135) polysaccharide vaccine is compulsory for intending Hajj pilgrims in line with the Saudi Arabia Government requirement. the vaccine confers immunity to an individual for 2 years (16, 17) both vaccines are strongly encouraged for pilgrims aged 50 years and above. the main purpose of this cross-sectional study is to evaluate the uptake of the recommended vaccine among Malaysian Hajj pilgrims in the year 2018. the study is the part of a large quasi-experimental study conducted on Malaysian Hajj and Umrah pilgrims in the year 2018 that are traveling through private hajj companies. Univariable and multivariable analyses were carried out using simple and multiple logistic regression. crude odds ratio, adjusted odds ratio (OR) and 95% confidence intervals (CIs) were used as
